definition: lifelike/true to life/distinctly/clearly
to force (sb to do sth)/to compel/to press for/to extort/to press on towards/to press up to/to close in on/euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]
variant of 逼[bi1]/to compel/to pressure
really/truly/indeed/real/true/genuine

sentences.english: This painting of mottled bamboos is really true to life.
sentences.chinese: 这幅湘竹画得十分逼真。

sentences.english: Ceramic restorative material is the best living substitutive material for natural tooth.
sentences.chinese: 陶瓷修复材料是最自然逼真的牙体组织人工替代材料。

sentences.english: The motion has a distinct realistic quality, as the objects first accelerate and then decelerate.
sentences.chinese: 动作显得很逼真，选择的控件先是加速，再略略减慢。

sentences.english: So he hold his realism by developing his theory on verisimilitude.
sentences.chinese: 这样他就借助逼真性观念坚持了自己的实在论。

sentences.english: They also may participate in living history and ranger tours.
sentences.chinese: 游客也可以参与到逼真的历史模仿和守林旅游中。

sentences.english: Examples illustrate that the method can meet the requirements of real time and reality.
sentences.chinese: 实验结果表明，该方法满足实时性和逼真性的要求。

sentences.english: This forms part of the position of the lathouse.
sentences.chinese: 这样就形成了逼真小客体的部份地位。

sentences.english: The terracotta figures are life-like and life-sized.
sentences.chinese: 陶俑形象逼真，与原物一样大小。

sentences.english: She has no duty to earthly accuracy or verisimilitude.
sentences.chinese: 她没有责任去确保世俗的精确和逼真。

sentences.english: Realistic appearance, the use of more realistic , non-polluting, more environmentally.
sentences.chinese: 外形逼真，使用更具真实感，无污染，更环保。

sentences.english: Several movies have tried and failed to generate lifelike animations of humans.
sentences.chinese: 一些电影尝试制作逼真的动画，但都失败了。

sentences.english: The relationship between flight simulator fidelity and flight test is presented.
sentences.chinese: 提出了飞行模拟器逼真度与飞行试验的关系。

sentences.english: He imitates animal calls and can hit off cows and sheep perfectly .
sentences.chinese: 他会学动物叫，能逼真地模仿牛羊的叫声。

sentences.english: The image of realistic-looking, full of zest for life.
sentences.chinese: 其形象逼真生动，富有生活情趣。

sentences.english: TV is a realistic lens art reproduction of real life, with verisimilitude .
sentences.chinese: 电视是写实的镜头艺术，再现生活真实，具有逼真性。

sentences.english: While they are peeing, the two figures move realistically.
sentences.chinese: 当他们尿的过程中，这两个雕塑看起来非常逼真。

definition: to imitate to perfection/to be remarkably true to life
the feeling that sth is genuine/sense of reality/in the flesh
vivid/lifelike
vivid and lifelike (idiom); true to life/realistic
living spirit, living image (idiom); true to life/vivid and realistic
to imitate to perfection/to be remarkably true to life
to pass off as genuine/spurious
realism/realistic portrayal/realistic/true to life
scene/tableau/picture/image/screen (displayed by a computer)/(motion picture) frame/field of view
vivid/lively
the feeling of actually being there
(idiom) to experience it for oneself/to actually *be* there (as opposed to reading about it etc)
fine/meticulous/careful
facial expression
to restore to the original state/to reconstruct (an event)/reduction (chemistry)
(stage) set
